ticket.subject: Anthony _ Magestore customi...
ticket.description:
Hello Anthony,

I am Sally back with you here. How are you doing?  :)

I have been informed by my customer support agent - Jan about your demand on having a new customization with Magestore as below:

_"I am writing to open a dialogue in relation to customisation works for our extensions from Magestore for Magento ver. 2.1.9 community edition. As I have held previous discussions into this matter with yourselves, find the tasks outlined below for ease of reference._
_1. Magestore Purchase Management = Fix Error
A. Go to ‘Purchase Management > Manage Suppliers’
i. It doesn’t work, reference screenshot titled ‘2018-01-13 (1)’.
ii. May you advise?
2. Magestore Inventory Management = Customisation
A. Definitions of Terminology
• MIN = Low Stock Level, Each Product Must be Modifiable
i. When a particular product hits the low level, then we receive a notification. Each product will have a different ‘MIN’ level.
ii. When a purchase order is created, we want to be able to view this attribute as a priority. I believe this is the case already with the extension because I tested your demo however I cannot create a supplier to test it now…
• MAX = Ideal Stock Level, Each Product Must be Modifiable
i. When we are in ‘Inventory Management > Stocks in Warehouse’ we desire to be able to modify a ‘MAX’ level. Each product will have a different ‘MAX’ level.
ii. When a purchase order is created, we want to be able to click a hyperlink next to the ‘MAX’ attribute, to make it easier for us since there are thousands of products.
B. MIN & MAX Attributes
Must be shown and editable in the following locations
• Purchase Management > Purchase Orders
Note: I cannot define the exact locations because I am unable to create a new supplier…
• Inventory Management > Stocks in Warehouse
C. Quantity Attributes Must Be Shown in
• In ‘All Supplier Products’
• Shown in ‘Purchase Order List’
• Note: I cannot define the exact locations because I am unable to create a new supplier…
D. The ‘Quantity’ that is being ordered, must be modifiable
• I believe this is the case already with the extension because I tested your demo however I cannot create a supplier to test it now…
3. Magento Order Management Fulfilment = In Need
A. I was under the impression that this would be included with the extensions that have been already purchased. Do we have to buy this module?
B. When preparing orders, we need pictures to be displayed so our staff identifies the items easier.
C. I need to be able to use the extension to tell you where the pictures need to be located, may you advise?
4. Inventory Management > Stocks in Warehouse = Customisation
A. We need to see the supplier associated to the product in this section.
B. We need to see the supplier associated to the product when preparing an order via ‘Purchase Management’.
C. I believe this is the case already with the extension because I tested your demo however I cannot create a supplier to test it now…
5. System > All Users > Users = Fix Error
A. After the installation of our extensions, we discovered that we are unable to delete users which is a Magento default feature.
B. It is in the opinion of one third party developer that this is due to your extension, find their notes highlighted below in bold.
C. “Developer completed his investigation and provided feedback that the issue with possibility to delete users occurs because of the Magestore extension._
_Developer checked delete method \Magento\Backend\Block\Widget\Button\ButtonList::remove and set stack trace output._
_As it can be observed via stack trace, first call is executed correctly, while second call is being executed after "Delete" button was displayed and being called by observer located under the following path: /var/www/html/app/code/Magestore/InventorySuccess/Observer/Sales/Order/View/BeforeToHtml.php which leads to the Magestore Inventory extension._
_This way, disabling of this extension should resolve the issue with users deletion.”
D. Find attached the stack trace log for your reference.
E. May you advise?
6. Migration of Inventory Data from ERP off live website to development website to Magestore’s Inventory Management Extension = Customisation
A. This must be arranged to be done as a last step.
B. The data must include all of our suppliers, current stock, our cost and et cetera
7. May you double check that the extensions are ready for launch (for use on a live website / production environment)? = Service_
_Kindly note, that we want to stage the migration of data as a last step. In other words, we do not desire to implement the works for the migration now, but at a time of our choosing."_

I would like to confirm that I have already received your requirement and am discussing with my customization team for the best solution.

I hope you can give me a little more time to check. I will try to get a feedback for you here soon :)



Best regards,
Sally

last_comment.body:
Hi Anthony,

Thank you so much for the cooperation. We really appreciate it :D
Have a lovely day, friend ~

All the best,
Jan

ticket.subject: Ajax Calls not Working
ticket.description:
Hi,

We are adding the RMA feature to the webpos and listed the RMA entries in view repairs page. When we change the status of the RMA, it will update the status on database using Ajax call. However, status is updating on the database only when inspect the page on the browser.

We have customized the task in below files.
/var/www/vhosts/the-music-house.com/crowdevent.nl/js/magestore/webpos/ui/components/rma/list.js
/var/www/vhosts/the-music-house.com/crowdevent.nl/js/magestore/webpos/ui/template/rma/list.html
/var/www/vhosts/the-music-house.com/crowdevent.nl/app/code/local/Magestore/Webpos/Model/Api2/Rma/Rest/Admin/V1.php

Screenshot for reference:
https://prnt.sc/hway3n

Same issue is happening with the orders listing based on the customer selection in RMA form. After placing the order, it does not get updated in the orders list. This scenario is also workinh only when we inspect the page on browser.

We have customized the task in below files.
/var/www/vhosts/the-music-house.com/crowdevent.nl/js/magestore/webpos/ui/components/catalog/product-list.js
/var/www/vhosts/the-music-house.com/crowdevent.nl/js/magestore/webpos/ui/template/rma/form.html
/var/www/vhosts/the-music-house.com/crowdevent.nl/app/code/local/Magestore/Webpos/Model/Api2/Rma/Rest/Admin/V1.php

Screenshot for reference:
https://prnt.sc/i212rw
https://prnt.sc/i21302
https://prnt.sc/i21395

Could you guys please check and let us know for anything need to take care of webpos?

Thanks

rows.subject: Bug_Other_After upgrade to 1.2.0 and Magento to 2.2.1 we cannot checkout zero subtotal

ticket.subject: Bug_Other_After upgrade to ...
ticket.description:
After upgrade to 1.2.0 and Magento to 2.2.1 we cannot checkout zero subtotal

When we on frontend have a discount code to get free item then choose store pickup which is also free so grand total = 0, we are presented with PayPal payment and CC payment and not "No payment information required".

If we change the Shipping Method configuration for Store Pickup to "Ship to allowed countries" = "Allow all countries" then the issue is fixed.

If we change this back to "Specific countries" then we are broken again.

It seems that "sallowspecific" this configuration sets actually impacts payment methods and not shipping countries.

Possibly relating to our upgrade from earlier version?

last_comment.body:
Hi Jason,

I'm Hanny - Account Manager from Magestore. Please let me assist you in this time.

Firstly, I'm sorry for the late response as we missed your ticket.

In order to check your issue in more details and solve it quickly, could you please provide us with the following necessary information:

- Magento admin account and Back-end admin URL path
- Your server FTP or SSH account (please check if it’s working properly before sharing with me)
- The file path to your current site on FTP

Also, our IP-address is 14.162.144.114 please add it to your whitelist in case that you have restricted your server access from outside.

Hope you can send all the information shortly so that I could access your site and find the solution to your issue in the shortest time.

Look forward to hearing from you soon!

Best regards,
Hanny

ticket.subject: Customisation Bug
ticket.description:
Hi Guys

We have been having issues with customers saying that when placing orders they were advised that there was stock when in fact there was no stock.

We have eventually identified the problem and discovered that it is a bug in the customisation work you carried out which I believe was done by Hades.

You customised the "Availability" on the front end as shown on the attached screenshot. If there is no available stock at either the local or supplier's warehouse then it displays "On Order with Supplier".

The problem occurs when for example there is qty 2 in stock and a customer places an order for 2. When you check the Magento Quantity attribute there is 0 stock which is perfectly correct and there is no free stock to allocate to further orders meaning that any future orders should be placed on backorder.

However the customised software still shows the product as "In Stock" until such time as the order is processed and then it correctly displays  "On Order with Supplier". 

This suggests that the customisation is not using either the Magento Qty attribute or the "Available Qty" in determining the correct Availability message to display on the front end.

Can you please investigate and advise.

Best Regards

Peter

last_comment.body:
Lynn
Case bình thường, c/e care tiếp nha

ticket.subject: One Step Checkout
ticket.description:
Hello!

We’re currently under development of a site that’s using your one step checkout extension for Magento 2.  I see references to three columns within the markup, and it appears this is a setting within your Magento 1 version, however I’m not seeing a way to use 2 columns for the Magento 2 version.  Is this a possibility?

Thanks!

last_comment.body:
Hi Brian,

I am Lynn - Account Manager from Magestore and I will assist you in this ticket.
Regarding your question, that's right, in One Step checkout Magento 2 there're no config for column, since M2 layout is different from M1.

Kind regards,
Lynn
